Landed in the sea & I noticed that my Kosmonaut was doing the breast stoke !!

Edited November 9, 2013 by Lohan2008

Really.....

You're like, the last one to learn about this.....

Edited November 9, 2013 by fatfluffycat

Really.....

Your like, the last one to learn about this.....

-*You're

-People don't know everything

-Chill out
Um it been like that... since EVA was added...
Yep they can swim, willing to swim him across the ocean back to KSC?
I'm glad I'm not the only one who didn't notice that until wayyyy late.
It took me a while to figure this out as I'm kinda paranoid about loosing kerbals, curiosity finally got the better of the me though, but only like a month ago.

I once parked a plane by a seashore and had the kerbal get out to swim to a close-by island. He swam much faster with physical time warp on. But when it swam back, his plane was sitting in the water. Running physical time warp allowed the plane to slide slowly down the slope of the shore and into the drink. So beware when swimming kerbals at time warp speeds.

Happily, the plane floated, and it's jet engines worked to push it back to shore.
Yep, they can swim and take samples of water ... it is .... wet
While I knew about swimming, I've never thought to take a sample of water before! I wonder if it has a different science value if done on Eve of Laythe...

Someone should make a jet ski mod!

Edit: Not sure where that off-topic outburst came from?!
Now we're near the topic, what settings need to be changed to make the seas transparent?

I once parked a plane by a seashore and had the kerbal get out to swim to a close-by island. He swam much faster with physical time warp on. But when it swam back, his plane was sitting in the water. Running physical time warp allowed the plane to slide slowly down the slope of the shore and into the drink. So beware when swimming kerbals at time warp speeds.

Happily, the plane floated, and it's jet engines worked to push it back to shore.

I loved that chapter.

Also, the waters of Laythe and Eve probably holds a metric ****ton of science.
@OP: Don't feel ad i only recently got the pun in Eeloo's name.

Im actually glad the OP made this thread. I figured theyd drown. Something ill have to try.
